title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 251.11 - Decision by hearing officer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 251.11 - Decision by hearing officer

State Regulations

Upon completion of proceedings, the hearing officer shall
issue a decision and submit the record of the case to the board. The record
shall include the petition, response, notice of hearing, motions, rulings, orders, stenographic report of the hearing, stipulations, exceptions, documentary evidence, any briefs or other documents submitted by the parties, objections to the conduct of an election or conduct affecting the results of an
election, and the decision of the hearing officer. Exceptions to a decision by
a hearing officer may be filed pursuant to section 253. 22 of this

Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
251.11

Renumbered from 251.18

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
